text: 075 bottle. Pours clear copper, white head, low retention. Citric, malty, lemony aroma, hints of candies. High carbo, high alco, rich complex taste of honey, fruits, candied apples, pears, caramel, sultanas. Aftertaste is dry, alcohol.
Clear dark amber colour. Intense malty and boozy aroma, relatively refreshing and hoppy. Flavour is malty, sweet and boozy, medium body, short finish. Nice!

750 ml obtained through Monastery Greetings. Pours a deep amber, nearly brown with a lingering effervescence. Aroma is subtle with hints of noble hops and yeast. Taste is bright on the front end but has a velvety, almost port-like finish. Apart from the lingering warmth, it's hard to tell this is 12%!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Along with Willy at his home 0,75l bottle of dark brown colored body with a off white head and a spicy caramel malt hops aroma a spicy caramel malt hops alcholic sweet fruity taste with an alcholic bitter finish
Biere tres puissante ,gout sucre legerement sirupeux, vraiment excellente, une belle biere de noel
Pours a brown body with a thin head. Rich aroma with a woody feel. Taste is complex, full of malty tones, a very subtle sourness and a warm mouthfeel.

Bottle at home. Pours dark amber with small white head. Aroma is caramel, dried fruits and roasted malts. Taste is dried fruits, yeast and malts. Mouth warming alcohol but surprisingly well hidden in the taste for 13%(!).

Pours a warm copper brown with amber highlights; thick & dense beige head; moderate amounts of lace. Aromas include dark breads, nuts, brown sugar, caramel, maple syrup, spices, and toffee. Incredibly complex flavors; it arrives with some nuts & spices and transitions smoothly into a malty middle with sugary/syrupy notes. The finish is rich with dark fruits, more syrupy, and caramel notes that are riding on a long, boozy hold on the palate. As the beer warms, different flavors will pop out with each new sip; the sweetness & booziness eventually takes over. Very highly carbonated right after the pour and holds for a bit; this keeps the beer crisp & lively for longer. The body is full. The finish is mildly sticky and very warm from the alcohol. Amazing & delicious but definitely a sipper (considering the size of the bottle & the ABV). Perfect for the winter season and is a fine example of the Belgian Strong Dark Ale style. Thoroughly enjoyed this to the last drop!

Bottle from Pede Drinks, Sint-Lievens-Houtem. Brown/amber colour, creamy beige foam. Nose of sweet dark fruit (plums, raisins), some caramel, green apples. Sweet, alcoholic, full body. Very nice winter sipper.
Refrigerated 75 cl bottle poured into a snifter. Aroma is dark candy sugar, medium body, lower carbonation, and a little lacing. Taste is dark candy sugar, yeasty, and spicy.
BBE 2015. Punertava väri, niukka vaahdotus, luumuisa huumaava tuoksu, suutuntuma alkoholin polttava, intensiivinen, tasapainossa, äärimmäisen nautittava mutta ei järin moniulotteinen. Ihan jepa 5/5
Gran cervesa . Realment, per nadal arriben unes cervess exel.lents!!

Bottle shared during the November THT tasting at deansos place. Pours a clear amber with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet malts, caramel, raising, dark fruits. Taste is very sweet, light bitter and a bit boozy. Medium body, low carbonation.
Bottle shared at the November THT at deansos place. Clear ruby-amber pour with some sedimentation floating around. Notes of sherry, dried fruit, caramel, a bit of chocolate.

Bottle at almost Deans final tasting, but well call it his final tasting anyway. Pours a clear amber beer with a small, quickly disappearing off white head on top. Aroma of sugars, malts, light boozy. Flavor is sweet, boozy, long sticky and strong. Definitely get the 12% abv in this one, but in a good way. Nice one.

75cl bottle shared at THT.
Medium off white head. Clear amber pour. Alcohol and a little sweet.

Sampled from bottle at "This is not really deansos last THT"-tasting. Clear lightbrown with thin offwhite head. Sweet toasted caramel malts. Fruity notes, white raisans, dates, light nuttiness, prune. Big sweet, light bitter. Medium body, buttery feel. Soft carbonation. Bittersweet finish.

Aromat średnio intensywny, suszone owoce, śliwki, karmel, przyprawy, alkohol. Kolor ciemnobursztynowy, klarowne. Piana obfita, drobna, trwała, zdobi szkło. W smaku słodkie, średnia pełnia, suszone owoce, karmel, drewno. Finisz mocno alkoholowy. Goryczka niska, wysycenie niskie.
Bush de Noël Premium - uzupełnienie ocen piw pitych przed używaniem ratebeer.

Bottle 750ml. corked. [ As Bush de Noël Premium (Scaldis Noël Premium) ].Clear medium yellow - amber orange color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, pale malt, caramel, dried fruit, moderate to heavy yeasty, belgium yeast, candy - sweet yeast, fruity hops - yeast, alcohol. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and light moderate bitter with a long duration, sweet malt, biscuit - marzipan malt, alcohol, fruity malt - fruity yeast. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20160422]

Lovely in every possible way, one of my favourite beers. Rather complex taste with some caramel flavours, perfectly balanced with the strong alcohol level of this beer. Its already great alone, but its also splendid for any degustation, and wonderful with dry sausage to come along. You cant regret this. APPROVED BY TAVERNY BLACK METAL CREW !

Bottle @ Home. Pours dark amber with an offwhite head. Aroma of malt, yeast, candy sugar, dark fruits, dates, light spice, alcohol. Flavor is rather sweet, malty, yeast, caramel, candy, dark fruit, wood, alcohol. Medium to full body, lively carbonation, sweet finish with loads of warming alcohol. 240416
Bottle. Pours brown with white head. Aroma of yeast, strong alcohol, plums, dark fruits, spice, caramel, heavy yeasty, ester. Taste is rather sweet, yeasty, spice, ester.

Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Clear dark amber with a small beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, dried fruit and yeasty. Flavor is very sweet and moderate bitter. Sweet and moderate bitter finish with lots of warming alcohol. 220416
Bottle. Nice creamy head with excellent duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are rich dark fruits, caramel, hops, malt and has a nice sweet finish.
Bottle. Frothy white good mostly nlasting head. Amber colour. Powerfull malty and hoppy aroma. Moderate bitter biscuit flavor. Average moderfate bitter finish. creamy palate. very nice.
clear amber liquid with frothy yellowish head. Aroma of barbaris caramel candy. taste is heavy sweet, med bitter, light sour, alcohol, caramel, barbariss. medium body, oily feel

Miris je jako slab, tek mali osjet nekakvog voća i mrvica mirisa alkohola.
Okusom neto nalik nekakvim trenjama/vinjama i isto sa laganim notama alkohola.
Očekivao sam da će me previe peći alkohol ali ugodno sam se iznenadio.
Solid, drinkable Belgian Dubbel alike. Alcohol well hidden- only a bit comes "out of" in aroma. Medium to light body. Some sugary notes in flavor. Im not WOW anymore about every Belgian beer.
Attractive dark amber with ruby highlights. Lasting creamy light beige head. Complex. Belgian yeast goodness. Fruits and spices. Great body. Great balance. Lots to love.
Complex beer. Light and dark fruit aspects, some holiday spice. Full bodied but easy to drink. Delicious.

Big bottle with commonmac. Mahogany with medium white head. Sweet spice aroma and boozy aroma. Sweet malt, some spice, clean finish. Good Christmas spice but not overwhelming. Bubble gum sweetness. Alcohol is not as prominent as it could be, which is good. Medium body. Really nice beer. Really nice.

Big boy bottle purchased at Total Wine and Spirits in Roseville. Poured into Belgian snifter glass. Darker hued amber copper color. Aroma has Belgian funk with some dark fruit notes. Alcohol warmth right away. Taste actually does have a piney, holiday feel to it. Dark fruit like prunes or raisins working well with a toffee/caramel backbone. Candied sugar comes through mid consumption. Finish is warming and comfortable like a winter sweater. Very good beer for a special occasion.

Bottle, bought @ Belgianbeerz. Pours deep, chestnuts brown with a small, staying, creamy beige head. Aroma has vinious, caramel, coriander, light oxidation. Low to medium carbonation, fine dry and quite creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has sweet malts, nice toasted caramel, esters, oxidation, vinious and warming. Nice and elegant.

Piana początkowo gruba i mydlana, szybko opada do kilku milimetrów ładnej, drobnej koronki. Barwa miedziana, przypomina herbatę, mętna (pływają drobinki drożdży). Aromat głównie owoców suszonych (gruszki, jabłka, śliwki, daktyle), karmel, miód spadziowy, przyprawy korzenne i likier. Dość płasko... W smaku likierowe, słodkie, winogronowe, jest też w tle niewielka kwaskowość czerwonych owoców. Przypomina ekstremalnie nagazowane Barley Wine. W afterteasie jakiś keks, rodzynki w spirytusie, makowiec i brandy. Goryczka niska, ziołowo migdałowa. Nagazowanie wysokie, szampańskie, mocno musujące w ustach po każdym łyczku. Alkohol wysoki, nie do końca ułożony. 
Zważywszy na prawie maksymalne noty na ratebeer, ekskluzywną butelkę, limitowana ilość, premium w nazwie i całą otoczkę wokół tego piwa jestem zawiedziony... Wiem, że po 2-3 latach leżakowania byłoby bardziej ułożone i szlachetne, ale ja kupując piwo chcę mieć wybór - wypić od razu bardzo dobre lub po kilkunastu miesiącach rewelacyjne. W tym przypadku spirytusowy alkohol zniekształca całe bogactwo i złożoność trunku w odbiorze...

Robe ambrée, mousse peu abondante. Nez explosif sur les fruits confits, la vanille. Bouche à lattaque explosive, de la puissance, du fruit, de lonctuosité mais une sucrosité un peu trop marquée. Une bière écoeurante, pas du tout mon style.

Kindly shared by Jaghana. Couleur ambrée sombre, légère mousse. Fort nez caramel cuit, fruits noirs, sucres, bubblegum. Gout malté toasté, caramel cuit, fruité noir, sucre, puis palais avec légères épices (un peu cardamome, canelle), fruits secs, bubblegum et alcool. Pas mal et ronde en bouche malgrés lalcool. Assez complexe et agréable.

Bottle 75cl, a dark amber beer with good off white head that goes quickly. Nose is on caramel and spices, burnt caramel touch. Aroma is on caramel and burnt caramel, quadrupel yeast that gives a bubble gum touch, spice, cinnamon, toffee, low carbonated, plum touch, alcohol notes.
Bottle @ Willems, Grobbendonk. Pours ruby amber with a creamy head and lacings. Dark fruit, bubblegum, alcohol and caramel. Vinous port notes. Warming.. Decent enough And sippable for 12%
Belle bière brun-roux au long gout épicé. Un petit cadeau à se faire pour passer une bonne soirée.
Erg zwaar bier. Geeft je een warm gevoel tijdens donkere winterdagen. Een hele fijne, zoete, ietwat alcoholische afdronk.
sample from bottle, poured a murky amber colour with an off coloured head. nose of sweet caramel malts, alcohol, burned sugar, cloves, and sweet raisins. to alcoholic. cant enjoy this

750ml bottle pours out a amber topped with a sand head. Nose is great roast malt caramel toffee belg yeast candy sugar and a nice pit fruit. Taste is more of the sweetness rich malts a little booze and plenty of the classic belg notes.

From the corked, caged 750 ml. bottle. 2014 batch. The pour is an attractive amber tone with plenty of reddish hue highlights and a lingering tan head. Decent lacing. I pick up a lot of traditional Belgian toasty barley malts, some spice, and a notable undercurrent of cherry. Better than medium body. Smooth. While I did not get any booze in the aroma it is certainly there in the taste as the alcohol burn warms my insides along with the sweetness of the Belgian malts and barley. It is Christmas in July I guess but I would very much enjoy this during a snowstorm too.

Nice malty taste and rasiny sugarcane aroma. The semi-sweet brew is full of well done spicy and warming alcohol. This very nice concoction is apt for a mature palate. Lovely velvet texture and carbonation.
Belgian yeast aroma with hints of malt. Taste of Belgian yeast and banana with a creamy full bodied feel. Sweet banana finish.
alcohol, golden, clear, minimal head, medium bitterness, alcoholtastethin feel, bitter, soft carbonation, looks like the beer is flavoured with extra alcohol.
Dark amber with medium yellow cap. Rich roasted caramel taste - sour, very sweet and some bitterness, touch of alcohol.
Bottle from Toft Vin, Copenhagen - brown pour with beige head. Sweet malty aroma and taste, brown sugar, caramel, yeasty, lots of dark fruits, pretty decent Belgium Christmas ale.
Bottle at Beer Station, Xiamen on 17/12/14. Pours hazy amber brown with a white head. Aroma of malt, caramel and Belgian yeast. Medium sweet finish, can detect the alcohol.

Bottle sampled at Essen Winterbeer Festival 2014. Pours clear brown with a tan head. Aroma of caramel, malt, light floral hops and overripe dark fruit. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter. Over medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle of 75cl, in a Trappist glass; from the fridge.

Good Christmal ale, with a great spiced aroma, beautiful appearance and marvelous taste of spices and yeast (a little bit like the Trappist one).
Cloudy and a little bit sticky palate.

Go try it !

pours chestnut brown, small white head. Aroma of spices, cinnamon, clove nutmeg all spice. Similar tastes with roasted nuts, molasses and boozy at the end, VERY sweet. Too sweet in my opinion. Medium to full bodied needed to let the carbonation settle a bit but was fine after a while. Overall just too sweet and boozy.

A Scaldis Noël nevű főzethez, jelen sörital alap verziójához korábban már volt szerencsém, ebben az esetben az ízélmény utóerjesztés biztosította fokozásának megvalósulását van lehetőségünk megvizsgálni. Az mindenesetre már biztosra vehető, hogy a tapasztalatok aggodalomra semmi okot nem adnak, s hogy bizakodásunk igazolást nyerjen, elsőként a jól ismert szivárványos aromafelhőkről leszakadt puha illatpamacsok érkezése simítja el a talajt a további élményeknek. Parfümös, likőrben ázó aszalványos nyalábok keringenek a levegőben, majd a mézben eltett befőttekhez hasonlatos jegyeket produkáló, elegánsan karcsú, élénken vibráló test terül el az ízlelés terepén. Sárga húsú gyümölcsök közepesre aszalt karaktere, édes gabonák emléke és cifra élesztő éle teszi mintaszerű belga specialitássá a szerkezetet, amely egy karácsonyi ital képének minden tekintetben maradéktalanul megfelel, a palackban történő utóerjedés adta sajátosságok pedig ha kifejtik is hatásukat, leginkább csak jótékony sejtelmességgel teszik azt.

2012 bottle. Clearish dark copper with a thin white bubbly cap. Belgian Amber nose with golden toast and leafy hops. The flavor is nicely Amber with a almond like sweetness with a touch of leafy hops and honey and gentle booze. Really nice.

750mL into wine glass. Cooper Orange with fine cream color head. Sweet nose of with a hint of Lennon and maybe thyme; floral. In the mouth sweet like the high ABV leads one to expect, but I dont find it objectionable like I do most barley wines. Hint of cinnamon and cloves in back. Light to medium find carbonation. Finishes with a bit of stickiness but not cloying.

Bottle. Sample at Kerstbierfest 2014. Clear copper brown pour with receding off white head. Aroma is quite fruity, very boozy, tons of boozy dried fruits, plums. Taste is malty, lots of brown sugar, booze soaked fruits. Palate is a bit heavy, med carbonation. Does not display the nice "lightness" of the other high ABV bush beers, this one seriously lacks balance or drinkability.

ASPETTO: mogano scuro, ricorda il whiskey, limpido, con schiuma giallognola, non molto fine, abbondante e molto persistente (ne rimane sempre un po nel bicchiere).
AROMA: maltato, fruttato (frutta rossa e matura), liquoroso, speziato (si sente bene soprattutto il fresco dellanice). 
GUSTO: pieno, caldo, avvolgente. Chiari sentori maltati e fruttati, di frutta matura, tra la quale emergono le ciliege ben rosse. Evidente liquoroso, un po di barricato e soprattutto ciliegie sotto spirito. Carbonizzazione abbastanza bassa. Corpo decisamente strutturato.
CONCLUSIONE: una birra fenomenale, che si fa assolutamente ricordare. Il sapore tende nettamente verso il dolce, senza però mai stancare ed essere stucchevole. Birra di gran classe, che accompagna cene importanti, ma che va benissimo anche bevuta da sola.

Snel zakkende schuimkraag met aromatische alcoholneus.
Bruin caramelkleurig sterk bier met zoetige afdronk.
Lekker winterbier.

750 ml bottle. Vintage 2014 - label says 12%. Gusher. Pours an orange/mahogany with lots of continuous carbonation but only a moderate head which dissipates quickly. Aromas of sweet malts, brown sugar, raisins, and light spice. Complex flavors of dark fruit (raisins and figs), burnt brown sugar, bitter orange peel, roasted malts, and a bit of Christmas spice. Bitter on the finish but a good Belgian Noel.
Rated based on notes taken 23 Dec 2011 -- An extremely complex beer. Complexity improves as it warms.
Pours a small beige head atop a clear reddish Amber body. Nose of huge plum. Very christmas-y somewhat hot and spicy. Very good.
Una belgian strong ale strepitosa. altamente alcolica, con sentori fruttati e speziati, malti caramellati, retrogusto speziato leggero
maybe some banana aromas. appear light brown without a head, light bitter, and medium sweet,. medium bodied, with a lively carbonation.
Lovely complex aroma, boozy, lightly spiced with licorice notes. Really tasty and substantial beer, a lovely sipper. A fine beer from Scaldis, Id happily have this anytime.
couldnt tell a huge difference in this one cept for the feel, which (if possible) was even smoother. Can i give it a 5.1?? Great winter brew.

Bière spéciale de Noël non filtrée et bien entendu refermentée, affichant au compteur (attention, tenez-vous bien ) 13 % abv !!!
Elle est précisée par le brasseur comme « the strongest belgian christmas ».
Je lai choisie quant à moi pour fêter mon 500ème rate de bière belge sur ratebeer... On fait plus mal comme choix  et je me permettrai de dédier
ce rate à un ami avec qui jai fait un passage mémorable au Troll et Bush de chez Dubuisson il y a quelques années (il se reconnaîtra), et ce jour-là jai dailleurs emporté 2 bouteilles de Bush de Nuits que lon inaugurait ...
Bouteille de 75 cl, sérigraphiée et ayant dépassé de 9 mois sa date limite.
Couleur brun roux tendance auburn.
Clarté nette, et même grande transparence de ce breuvage. Ce qui est très amusant au vu de son degré alcoolique et de son âge...
Bulles moyennes peu nombreuses (normal).
Mousse qui ne peut résister au 13 % qui poussent derrière 
Arômes de fruits des bois, Margaux, poire au vin, bois dacajou.
1ère bouche au volume souple à soyeux, sur des fruits noirs, du fût de vin en chai de grande maison.
Arrière-bouche maltée, chaude, aux nuances vineuses.
2ème sur le vin rouge fort, la lie de vin, le fût de vin (et pas la bibine de la vigne à papa...).
3ème bouche aussi large que les orages sur 100 kms en montagne, quand on les voit depuis chez soi...
Arrière-bouche de porto, whisky dIslay très vieux, Margaux très âgé.
La longueur donne des pointes de muscade et de poivre noir du moulin sur des 
malts très complexes. Du bois de fût splendide, qui fait littéralement rêver, on est strictement dans lexceptionnel. On trouve aussi des pointes de bois blanc de grande forêt dont on fait les merrains. Cest prodigieux.
La levure est une pure merveille aux mille nuances, et qui les transmet donc à la bière 
Lalcool, à ce niveau abv, on parle dexception, mais son travail est merveilleux
dans laccompagnement des saveurs. (Petite parenthèse, pour preuve de sa 
qualité, le lendemain matin vous êtes frais comme un gardon, sans aucune problématique à la carapace... et cest suffisamment important pour être signalé).
La finale est sans mots, donc ineffable, grandiose, à susurrer !!!
CONCLUSION : bière « noble » par excellence. La qualité des saveurs fait partie du plus haut niveau de la dégustation des grands vins. Quelle récompense que de pouvoir fêter mon 500ème rate belge avec un pareil breuvage, qui est un pur élixir. On peut parler dune quintessence de bière...
Son évaluation à 500 sur 100 me paraît non seulement juste mais très adaptée 
à la circonstance...

The refermented version of the classic Bush de Noël, in 75 cl bottles. Off-white, pale beige foam, ravishing colour of dark red copper. Powerful, tempting aroma of orange peel, cake, caramel, honey, pepper, ginger, honey, bourbon... Taste kicks of with a sweetness of candied fruits, rather strong carbonation, yeasty, honeyish, smooth and vinous mouthfeel, finishing in warming, brandy-like alcohol without becoming astringent - the trademark of any well-made beer of great strength. Im not surprised that an already great beer becomes even greater when refermented - see also Bush Ambrée Triple, for example.
Een degelijk lekker kerstbier met een goede volle smaak. Een aanrader in koude dagen

Amber colour, mediumsized slightly off-white head. Aroma is alcohol, some cardboard and mild earthy notes. Flavour is fruity, mild alcohol, some cardboard and some slight earthy notes.

75 cl bottle @ PBF IX.
Pours murky orange color with a small lasting head. A bit weird cardboardy notes on the aroma, otherwise nice caramel and ripe fruits with sweetish malts, some yeast also. Sweet malts and toffee on the flavor, quite strong alcohol burn and some spicy yeasty notes on the aftertaste. Feels quite old but it has still quite a lot of flavor. No freshness info so not sure about the age though.
4334

750 ml bottle @ PBF IX. Pours a dark amber colour with a small head. Aroma is rather rich with apricot, sweet juicy peach and some yeastiness. Flavour of sweet maltiness, toffee, white grapes, apricot, and grains, yeastiness and alcohol. Alcohol is very strong here. Full bodied and thick mouthfeel. A compelx slow-sipping beer.

Bottle 750ml (PBF IX)
Dark amber color, small beige head. Alcohol, berries and toffee in the nose. Medium-bodied. Lots of toffee, alcohol. Sweet fruity flavor. A bit older vintage (no BBE marked) but still lots of booze (+ now toffee).

750ml bottle @ PBF IX
Pours dark reddish brown with a foamy head. Aroma of spices, malts, ripe fruits, toffee, plums and yeast. Taste is sweet, ripe fruity and yeasty notes with some notes of toffee and plums. Finish is sweet and sticky with some maltiness and spicy ripe fruity notes. Quite heavy and sweet.

75 cl bottle @ PBF Ⅸ
No BBE info, but the option for marking that ends at year 2008
Aroma has alcohol and caramel. Also hints of berries. Flavour has caramel, Belgian yeast, warming alcohol, some berries and ripe fruits. Perhaps also some cardboard-like malty tones. Alcohol disturbs on some sips.
best find : rich hop taste with long finish & very strong aftertaste (no sugary taste afterwards). A real gem.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ after spring garden workout with tobak. Huge foam. Brown haze. Spicy. Dark fruit. Sweetness hides the alcohol very well. A bite more complexity needed. More malt than added sucker.

Bottled 750ml. -from Svijet Piva Zagreb. Amber coloured with red glare, medium sized off-white head that went away fast, slight yeasty and alcoholic nose. Sweet malty, fruity, spicy and warming alcohol with touch of metal and caramel in the finish. Pleasant one.

31/XII/13 - 75cl bottle from Geers (Oostakker) @ home, paired with an assorted cheese plate - BBE: 2013 (2013-1208) 
Note: well, ageing this beer for 3 years in my cellar was a good idea! :-) 
Clear dark red brown beer, small aery fizzy beige head, unstable, dissipates quickly, non adhesive. Aroma: lots of caramel, some vanilla, sweet and sugary, malts, honey. MF: soft carbon, full body. Taste: caramel, hop bitterness, citrus, bit fruity, dried fruits, vanilla notes, cookie dough. Aftertaste: bitter hops, alcohol, bit sugary, caramel, citrus touch, dried fruits and some banana. Paired very well with the cheese plate!

Bouteille 75cl de et partagée avec Tderoeck. BB 12/2013.
Ambrée, col beige léger.
Arôme est maté, caramel, fruité noir garde un bouquet légèrement sucré avec pas mal de caramel, note grillé en rétro.
Palais est malté avec les 13% de suite présent, caramel et fruité noir entre prune et raisin, date ponctué par un sucre candy. Le tout reste très belge dans lapproche avec une bière rivalisant avec les grosses productions trappiste voire abbaye. Complexe et nettement plus savoureuse que de souvenir.

Aroma agradable y sumamente frutal. Notas dulces, en donde se distinguen notas a frutos rojas y almibar.

En cuanto a apariencia, color cobre con destellos rojizos, de cuerpo ligero a medio. Carbonatacion y corona de espums baja.

En boca, suave, dulce y frutal.

Al paladar es una cerveza sabrosa e interesante. Las notas dulces y frutales destacan, sin embargo es una cerveza fácil de beber y no es tan compleja ni alcohólica a pesar de sus 12 grados.

En resumen una excelente y savrosa cerveza de temporada.

As Scaldis Noël Premium. Poured into a trappist glass. Mahogany color with a cream colored head that settles but leaves a thin layer. Aroma is quite fruity with some strong apple notes as well as some banana and clove. Flavor is dark fruit with a slight sour/tartness, and some spices towards the finish. The bite from the sour/tartness mellows as it warms, and the spice notes become more apparent. Medium/Full bodied with a slightly dry finish. Remarkably drinkable for 13%. Overall a nice Christmas ale.

750ml bottle. Poured an amber color with a larger sized off white head. Aromas of yeast and bananas/fruity. Tastes of the same fruitiness, yeast, and caramel. Alcohol content well hidden and creeps up on you. Extra point for drinking on Christmas Eve wrapping presents ...

Grote fles, Premium en toch maar 12 % ? De fles is bijna leeg, hik. Bruinsige kleur, veel koolzuur tijdens het inschenken. Ruikt wat zoetzurig. Smaakt wat naar caramel en zoet snoep. Ik vind het te zoet en weinig diepgang. Ik had er eigenlijk meer van verwacht.
750 ml bottle, 2 years old. Love malt and spice nose, chocolate. dried fruity, plums. Lovely fruits, just right spice, alcohol invisible. Great body, great age. WOnderful.

Sötét borostyán színű, sörcsoda, bézs habbal, komplex gyümölcsös aromával, és karamellel, valamint csodálatos malátás-szirupos, gyümölcsös ízzel, amiben a kegyetlen alkoholmennyiség jól megbújik. Szinte tökéletes karácsonyi sör

Pours amber , small to no head 
Boozy smell
Good carbo 
Taste is booze and sugar
Caramel aroma. Some dark fruits. Nice syruppy texture. Nice sweet flavour. Somewhat of an alcohol burn.

(Bottled, 0.75l, "Premium", 13% ABV, rated 12/25/2005) Dark reddish amber with a medium, tight head. Aroma of semi-dark malts, toffee, orange-peel and alcohol. Sweetish, toffeeish, quite alcoholic flavor with lots of anise and grainy malt. Medium-bodied, quite alcoholic and sticky palate with low carbonation. This is not a brew to take lightly - but luckily you will figure it out right from the start, as the 13% is not very well hidden. Its not bad, though, as the maltiness is strong enough. A true Xmas knock-out, if you dont mind the alcohol. If you do, youll find plenty of better alternatives.

super premium beer fantastic taste and smell started off exploding foam everywhere but gorgeous coppery color and nice tan head flavour reminds me of candy sugar plums and really good belgium yeast hella good beer

Appearance: beautiful clear coppery amber pour with a huge, thick, creamy, fluffy light tan head that belies the high abv); this is a gorgeous beer. Aroma: hugely fruity (figs, dates, raisins, cherries, carameled apples), with notes of brown sugar, caramel, cloves, cinnamon and allspice. Taste: fruitcakey, with all the fruits noted in the aroma plus a little banana, and all the caramel, toffee, brown sugar, and spice foretold in the nose as well.  Finish: 	sweet, with the fruits fading a little bit to give way to a pleasantly malty and slightly boozy warmth. Notes: Alcohol was incredibly well-hidden, and the beer tasted, looked, and smelled like Christmas. Very good.  First beer of Beerdvent 2013.

dark amber colour, huge, stable brownish head; aroma of intensive fruittyness (figs, apple, maybe someberries and minimal plum, as well), biscuit, caramel, and some yeast; taste of rich maltyness, brown sugar, some yeast, dried fruits, some roastedness, spices and alcoholic warmth; perfect belgian strong ale
nice sour aroma,brown, clear, light brown foam,light sweetness, lightly sour, medium body, soft carbonation, fizzi and nice harmonic finish.
Great beer. LIght amber coloured and clear. Has a white head, diminishing. Sweet, acid aroma, fruity notes, berries too. Heavy yeasty flavor, notes of solvents.

330 ml bottle. Pours dark brown, red hues at the edges, small white head. Sweet malt nose with a nice spiciness to it. A very well-balanced dubbel, with the right mix of spice, caramel, sweetness and Belgian yeast. Overall Im real impressed with this, the caramel malts and subtle dark fruit was real prominent in the finish and the aftertaste. Really solid and tasty.

Pours hazy and deep amber with a large tan head with good lacing. Aroma of yeast, caramel, spice and berries. Sweet flavour that ends up more dry and with some alcohol. Medium to full bodied, oily text. and average carb. An excellent x-mas brew.

I REALLY enjoyed this beer. It has very nice aromas of dark fruit, brown sugar and doughy cookies. Flavors are more of the same but is balanced nicely by the spices and yeast. Pours a dark orange/ruby color with a frothy off-white head that leaves some lacing. Full-bodied and the alcohol definitely makes its presence known but is not overpowering and gives just enough warmth and bite on the finish. A big beer that is very well done.

Bottle Courtesy of CheeseMan. With the passing of Walt, this was the only thing I had in my cellar that he hadnt rated, or that I thought he would like (since he liked the regular one), so it seemed an apropos toast. Pours copper with a good sized head, lively carbonation, and some floaties at the end. Huge Christmas cookie aroma, with candied fruits and malt. Sweet flavor, brown sugar and dark fruit, with enough yeasty and peppery character to stop on the right side of cloying. Big time alcohol, but the finish is warm and velvety, a fine nightcap and a fine tip of the glass to fellow short guy with a big heart.....Sir Walt.
(bottle 19/12-2011) Very low white head, amber brown color, very slightly sour taste, alcohol taste. BB date 09/09/2012.
Coppery red with short lived light tan head. Sugar hits the nose followed by cherry and raisin. Taste is sweet malt and yeasty. Quick flash of alcohol fades immediately.

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2015 Stesso profilo della versione "base" ma questa versione Premium (provata un paio di giorni dopo) offre un briciolo di complessità in più, con aromi speziati e "caldi" emergono con più facilità.

Bottled, 0.75l. Clear deep copper color with mid-sized frothy tan-like head and light lacing. Aroma of rich malt, spicy hops, caramel, candy sugar and dark fruits, especially cherries, raisins and plums. Taste starts sweet and rich malty, followed by refreshing fruity and yeasty notes. Mouthfeel is quite syrupy. Despite of high ABV, alcohol is very well hidden, however, it still hits you back from the ambush. Full body, sticky texture and moderate carbonation in palate. No need to say more...
Bottle. Pours a dark amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty spicy dark fruit aroma. Sweetish malty spicy caramel and dark fruit flavor. Has a sweetish malty spicy caramel finish.

I had this after waking up drunk in my Brussels hotel room and recall it being really rich , spicy -and surprisingly easy to drink at 5.am after 3 hours sleep..I proceeded by drinking a can of Bel Veue kriek in the shower with my girlfriend  and I  was good to go for the day !!!

750 ml bottle into tulip glass, best before 2014.  Pours lightly cloudy red orange color with a 1 finger foamy off white head with good retention, that reduces to a thin lace that lingers.  Slight spotty foamy lacing clings to the glass.  Aromas of big raisin, cherry, prune, caramel, apple, brown sugar, molasses, cinnamon, candi sugar, pepper, earth, toast, clove, and herbal yeast spiciness.  Damn nice aromas with big complexity, strength, and balance.  Taste of raisin, prune, pear, apple, toast, caramel, molasses, brown sugar, toffee, candi sugar, cinnamon, pepper, earth, clove, and herbal spiciness.  Fair amount of yeast spiciness on the finish; with lingering notes of complex dark fruits, caramel, toffee, brown sugar, molasses, toffee, candi sugar, cinnamon, clove, pepper, and herbal yeast spiciness on the finish for a while.  Fantastic flavor complexity, robustness, and balance of flavors; with a good balance of spicy flavor despite big maltiness; with zero cloying flavors present after the finish.  Medium carbonation and fairly full bodied; with a slick and fairly syrupy mouthfeel that is very nice.  Alcohol is extremely well hidden at 13%; with hardly any warming noticed after the finish.  Overall this is an outstanding Belgian dark ale!  Huge balance and complexity of big robust flavors; and very smooth to sip on for 13%.  A highly enjoyable strong Belgian style offering.

Had to use a corkscrew to open this fine beer.  Pours a clear lite amber with little head.  Mild nose with malty molassus aromas.  Very smooth and blended flavors of honey, carmel apple and booze.  Finishes clean and hot.  Sure love holiday beers.

Aroma of sweet apples. Beautiful rich golden amber color.  A little alcohol forward...some peach - very yeasty...finishes with more alcohol...a bit of bubbly tang at the end.  Pretty heavy - medium-high carbonation.

Bottle: 25.12.2012
Visual: Pours Hazy walnut brown and fine off white head.
Aroma: Spicy and Sweet.
Taste: Full blend of malty sweetness notes with spices (anis and caramel). medium to full body and some carbonisation.

 


Visual:
Aroma:
Taste:

Bottle from Asahiya. Heavy fortified honey aroma. Dark tea color, little head. Smooth and extremely sweet initial, with prunes and raisins; some fumes invade the sinuses in mid; final slides down smooth and sweet again. Medium-light body. Great mouthfeel. Hides the high alcohol very well -- one friend said that he kind of wanted to feel it a bit more. Smooth and pleasant stuff

Slightly smoother than the Bush Noel and 1% stronger. This is the second year running Ive tried this, from a 75cl caged & corked bottle. Alcohol dominates, dark & malty with a demerara sugar sweetness. To me this is like one of those super strength lagers, brewed for the alcohol content above anything else. OK as far as strong beers go but lacking complexity.

UPDATED: DEC 21, 2012 75 cl. bottle sample @ 18th Christmasbeer festival in Essen. This beer was completely new to me, I initially wondered even whether or not this wasnt simply a renamed version of the regular Noël but apparently this is the same beer but re-fermented in the bottle which is quite interesting. In hindsight I do sort of wish that I had either a better recollection of the regular version or that I had tasted them alongside. I did look up my old notes which sort of helped me to recall the taste of the old version, unfortunately my notes back then tended to be less elaborated than my current ones frequently are. Either way it pours a dark red amber with a white head on the sides. The beer is probably not too far from room temperature. Smell is that of sweet caramel, syrup, herbal with dark fruits. Taste is unfortunately held back a bit by a surplus of carbonation, bit of a pet peeve of mine, bitter herbs & spices, sticky malts, dark fruits, tad liquorice, brown sugar, yeast overripe fruits & some minor booze. This is a bit too fizzy for me, the regular version is less subtle but if memory serves me right, this one is slightly less my thing, it is still not too shabby.

Bottle from Belgianbeershop.com Head: off white, dissapears very quickly. Colour: dark red brown. Aroma: sweet, malty, fruity, clear alcohol presence. Taste: malty sweetness, fruits, caramel, spicy, complex but well balanced. High ABV is detectable. This is a very fine Christmas beer.

Bottle - 750mL corked and caged. Cant believe Im the first American to have this one.... Under the "Scaldis Noel Premium" moniker. Label shows 12% ABV. Dark ruby with a tall, dense, foamy tan head. Aroma is sweet malt, caramel, soft spice, soft, dusty yeast, dark fruits and soft booze. Taste is very sweet with lots of sweet malt notes, caramel, brown sugar, ripened, dark fruits, alcohol, cake notes, dusty yeast and soft spiciness. Body is medium with a strong, effervescent carbonation. Mild boozy warmth for the 12% ABV plus theres an abundant stickiness from the sugars. Ends with more caramel, overripe dark fruits, brown sugar, sweet malt, booze, rum cake, yeast notes and light spices. Tasty!

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2012 Sampled at OBER Kerstbierfestival 2012. Hazy orange brown color, small beige head. Smell malts and sweetness. Taste malts, sweetness, alcohol, some overripe fruits. Nicely balanced. Full body, full carbonation. Quite like it.

2007-12-14, corked bottle, as Scaldis Noël Premium, 13% ABV, 7-4-7-3-15=36Hazy dark amber color. Appley malt aroma, with walnuts. Medium body, alcoholic, with sweet caramel/malty flavor, with apples and walnuts. Correct bitterness. Should I try it aged? Anyway, quite good.

Bottle at home. 
Nice spicy aroma. 
Walnut brown and fine off white head one finger. 
Very full taste pleasant blend of malty sweetness notes of anis and liquirice. 
Very nice ale!

Bolton Brew Rocks !!
Bottle. Hazy brown colour with a biege head. Aroma and flavour of spice, malt, caramel, alcohol and with hints of chocolate.

75 cL bottle, seriously this deserves a sep. listing as it is has a dif. ABV and dif. label. Light caramel malt aroma and a mild alcojol aroma. Pours slight hazy brown with a lacing off-white head. light spiced malt based aroma. Flavour is sweet caramel with a distinct caramel malt base. Nice and different from the normal noel.

earthy, barnyard, leather, alcohol, rotten eggs, cough drop, herbs, chocolate, brown, sparkling, brown foam, rocky head, heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness, heavily sour, umami, full body, creamy, oily feel, lively, long finish,
